msgSnippet: I did wonder about using classloaders to load mock versions of specified classes. One possibility would be to use an alternative source tree for mock classes

I did wonder about using classloaders to load mock versions of specified
classes.

One possibility would be to use an alternative source tree for mock classes
with
the same fully qualified name.

Another possibility would be to load a class from a different package in the
same source
tree and rename it.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steve Freeman [mailto:steve@...]
> Sent: 22 August 2001 01:06
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] About mock object :!
>
>
> From: "Franksun" <franksun@...>
> > I only can mock objcect from interface ?
> > If some complex objcect no interface and I want to mock it .
> > How I get it ?
>
> subclass it and override just those methods you need to use. The
> implementations of the overridings should be absolutely simple
> (just return fixed or preloaded values). If the object is not
> well designed this can be tricky, but sometimes you can get
> through with a little careful refactoring.
>
> Steve
>
